marketNews.title: Indonesian Government Begins Transfer of Multiple SOE Shares to BPI Danantara
marketNews.content: The Indonesian government began transferring ownership of several state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to BPI Danantara, as disclosed on Monday, 24 March 2025. The SOEs transferred include Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN), Telkom Indonesia (TLKM), Semen Indonesia (SMGR), Jasa Marga (JSMR), Waskita Karya (WSKT), Wijaya Karya (WIKA), Adhi Karya (ADHI), PP (PTPP), Garuda Indonesia (GIAA), and Krakatau Steel (KRAS). Although the shares transferred are the Series A class, they remain under government control.

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s February 2025 Refined Tin Exports Surge 7,040% YoY
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Trade reported that Indonesia's refined tin exports reached 3,926.93 metric tons in February 2025, a 150% month-over-month increase and a 7,040% year-over-year surge from the 55 tons recorded in February 2024, when shipments were delayed by mining-permit issues.

marketNews.title: BPI Danantara Announces Full Governance Structure and Advisory Board
marketNews.content: CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, announced on Monday, 24 March 2025 the full board of directors and the complete list of advisors for Danantara Indonesia. The advisory board includes Ray Dalio, Helman Sitohang, Jeffrey Sachs, F. Chapman Taylor, and Thaksin Shinawatra. In addition, Danantara has a supervision committee, a risk-management committee, and an investment-and-portfolio committee.

marketNews.title: GoTo Announces Tiered Hari Raya Bonus for Driver Partners
marketNews.content: GoTo (GOTO) Chief of Public Policy & Government Relations Ade Mulya said the company is beginning to distribute Hari Raya bonuses (BHR) to driver partners. The bonuses are not classified as regular THR; they are a presidential directive and are scaled to the company’s financial capacity. Recipients are grouped into five categories: IDR 50,000; 100,000; 500,000; 800,000; and 1.6 million.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Approves New President-Director, Final Dividend of IDR 208.4 and Reports 42% YoY Net Profit Rise in Feb 2025
tickerNews.content: The 2024 fiscal-year dividend for Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) was approved at approximately IDR 52 trillion, representing an 86% dividend-payout ratio (2023: 80%). The final dividend is IDR 208.4 per share, yielding about 5.8% based on the Monday (24 Mar) closing price of IDR 3,610. An interim dividend of IDR 135 per share was already paid in January 2025. The board also approved the appointment of Hery Gunardi as president-director, replacing Sunarso (in post since 2019). Hery previously served as president-director of Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS).

tickerNews.title: BBRI CoC Normalizes After January Spike, Supporting Profit Recovery
tickerNews.content: CoC (cost-of-credit) for BBRI’s bank-only book normalized to 3.28% in February 2025 (January 2025: 5.57%, February 2024: 6.72%). Provisions fell to IDR 3.3 trillion (-49% YoY, -41% MoM), bringing the 2-month (2M25) CoC to 4.42% (2M24: 4.38%). The level remains above the management’s FY25 consolidated guidance of 3-3.2%, but the decline signals that front-loading provisions have passed. Asset-quality remains a focus ahead of the 1Q25 earnings call.

tickerNews.title: BBRI NIM Recovers to 6.39% in February 2025
tickerNews.content: BBRI’s bank-only Net Interest Margin (NIM) rose to 6.39% in February 2025 (February 2024: 6.17%; January 2025: 6.15%) as Net Interest Income reached IDR 9.3 trillion (+3% YoY, +4.7% MoM). Interest expense fell 8.7% YoY to IDR 3.9 trillion as time-deposit balances dropped 9.8% YoY. Over the 2-month period, NIM averaged 6.25% (2M24: 6.4%), still below the FY25 guidance of 7.3-7.7% but management expects credit growth and better liquidity in 2Q25 to lift NIM.

tickerNews.title: BBRI OPEX Surges 111% YoY in February 2025
tickerNews.content: BBRI’s operating expense (OPEX) rose to IDR 4.3 trillion (+111% YoY, -9.6% MoM) in February 2025, pushing 2-month OPEX to IDR 9.1 trillion (+37% YoY). The increase is mainly due to a IDR 4.2 trillion rise in labour costs, driven by timing differences in the accounting of holiday-allowance (THR) expenses. A more apple-to-apple OPEX comparison with the prior year will be visible in the 1Q25 results.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Acquires 5.33% Stake in SSIA
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) acquired a 5.33% stake (250.6 million shares) in Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) through the PDNI HPAM – CAP Fund. The transaction, recorded in KSEI data on 20 March 2025, has no disclosed monetary value. Previously TPIA held no >5% stake in SSIA.

tickerNews.title: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa Posts 39% YoY Net-Profit Rise in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) reported net profit of IDR 952 billion for 4Q24, a 39% YoY and 53% QoQ increase. The full-year 2024 net profit reached IDR 2 trillion (+3% YoY), beating the consensus (125% of the 2024F estimate). Gross-margin rose to 37.8% (+280 bps YoY, +350 bps QoQ) and operating-margin rose to 18.6% (+440 bps YoY, +330 bps QoQ), the highest since 3Q21 and 1Q21 respectively. For 2024, gross-margin was 32.7% (2023: 32.6%) and operating-margin 12.6% (2023: 12.4%). Cement-sales volume grew 6% YoY in 4Q24, lifting total 2024 volume to +8.4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: NISP Announces 2024 Dividend of IDR 106 per Share
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) plans to distribute a 2024 dividend of roughly IDR 2.4 trillion (IDR 106 per share), corresponding to a 50% payout ratio. The record-date is set for the regular market on 8 April 2025 with payment on 17 April 2025. Using the Monday (24 Mar) close of IDR 1,310, the implied dividend yield is 8.1%.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Buys 220.7 Million SCMA Shares at IDR 200
tickerNews.content: Elongated Eagle Karya (EMTK) purchased 220.7 million shares of SCMA at IDR 200 per share, totaling about IDR 44 billion. The stake rose from 63.33% to 63.63%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Announces Share Buyback Up to 95 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) plans to buy back up to 95 million shares, allocating up to IDR 100 billion, with a maximum price of IDR 1,680 per share. The buy-back will run from 21 March to 2 May 2025 and does not require a shareholders’ meeting because of an OJK-granted relaxation.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Reports 5% YoY Cement-Sales Growth in February 2025
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia (SMGR) recorded a cement-sales volume of 3 million tonnes in February 2025, a 5% YoY and 3% MoM increase. The 2-month (Feb-Mar) total reached 6 million tonnes, down 1.3% YoY. February sales were 72% bag-type, rising slightly from 72.5% in January; the 2-month share was 72.3%.

tickerNews.title: ERAL Financial Results 4Q24 – Net Profit Down 6% YoY
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) posted a net profit of IDR 44 billion for 4Q24, a 6% YoY decline and a 35% QoQ drop. The full-year 2024 net profit was IDR 201 billion, down 4.4% YoY. Revenue grew 36% YoR to IDR 1.4 trillion and 7.1% QoQ, while operating-margin fell to 3.8% (4Q24: 5.2% and 3Q24: 5.8%). The higher OPEX-to-sales ratio reached 11% (4Q23:  9.6% ).

tickerNews.title: WINS Covers “       …          …  …  …  … … … … … … …
tickerNews.content: Wintermar Offshore Marine (WINS) reported a net profit of US$2.8 million for 4Q24, a 56% QoQ decline and a 28% YoY drop. The 2024 total net profit was US$22.5 million, well below the firm’s 80.5% consensus estimate. The decline was driven by a 10.1% QoR-quarterly revenue drop and a US$0.1 million other-income loss, while the other-…
